meanings.definition: A bowling pin that stands at the front of the triangular arrangement of pins
meanings.sent1: The headpin in bowling is the first pin you aim to knock down.
meanings.sent2: Make sure you aim for the headpin when bowling to get a strike.
meanings.sent3: When the headpin fell, it looked like the leader of the pin group was taking a nap.
meanings.sent4: The headpin stood tall like a guardian at the front of the pin formation.
meanings.sent5: The headpin, like a king, commands the attention of all other pins in bowling.

meanings.definition: A pin used in sewing to secure fabric pieces together
meanings.sent1: She carefully placed the headpin to hold the fabric in place before sewing.
meanings.sent2: Don't forget to remove the headpin after you finish sewing the fabric together.
meanings.sent3: The headpin held the fabric like a tiny hero keeping everything in order.
meanings.sent4: Her fingers moved swiftly, securing the fabric with the headpin like a skilled tailor.
meanings.sent5: The headpin, like a tiny sentinel, guarded the fabric pieces from shifting.

meanings.definition: The main or top part of something, such as a nail or screw
meanings.sent1: Make sure the headpin of the nail is flush with the surface for a neat finish.
meanings.sent2: The headpin of the screw should be securely fastened to hold the shelf in place.
meanings.sent3: The headpin of the nail peeked out like a curious little explorer.
meanings.sent4: The headpin of the screw, like a crown, held everything together at the top.
meanings.sent5: The headpin of the nail, gleaming in the light, was the finishing touch to the project.
